data.title: Lovely lunch
data.text: Love this chain. We ate lunch here. The food was delicious and the staff were very helpful, efficient and courteous.

data.title: Pricey place for breakfast.
data.text: This is a higher end chain restaurant, I have eaten at a couple in Manhattan, this one in Alexandria is pretty much the same so it is nice to know that they are consistent.  I had the egg white, mushroom and goat cheese omelette which was served with nice pieces of bread and a salad.  I enjoyed it, but it was around $15.00.  My mom and Aunt were in sticker shock at the menu and only had cheese danishes and coffee which they enjoyed.

data.title: Great bakery, pastry shop!
data.text: Great for breakfast/brunch.  Very tasty, very fresh, wide variety.  If you are in Washington D.C. you owe it to yourself to try this place!  My wife and I have been twice and loved it both times.  This is a must try.

data.title: Wonderful location and nice food
data.text:
The location and atmosphere are excellent.  We had delicious break fast.  The bread basket was small and was not hot,although it was fresh. 
The salad are fresh and good.
I liked the avocado touch with bread.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for joining us! We are so glad you had such a nice time. See you again soon.

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Definitely gone down hill a bit :-(
data.text:
We were here last year and it wasn't too bad... this year, it seemed very grungy, dirty (the bathroom was pretty disgusting) and the food was not of the same caliber as we are used to at LPQ.

To boot, it seems to have been completely taken over by families with babies... no longer somewhere you can go for a quiet and relaxing breakfast as it's wall to wall screaming kids...  

We will be finding somewhere new for our quiet/relaxing breakfast (unfortunately).

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are very sorry to hear about your poor experience and have passed along your comments to our management team to take into consideration. Thank you for your feedback.

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great bread. Expensive. Poor service.
data.text:
The bread is very good.  The small bread basket is small. It is supposed to come with butter and jam.  We finally got jam from the next table. We went downstairs to get the butter from the front counter.

The jam is tasty.

Plain coffee comes in a small pot that gives you maybe 2 cups. $4.

The service sucks.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
While we are glad to hear you enjoyed your food, we sincerely apologize for the poor service and would love an opportunity to make this up to you. Please reach out to us at questions@lepainquotidien.com

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cute place with good food.
data.text:
We were looking for a breakfast place in Alexandria and after a Google search saw that Le Pain Quotidien was nearby.  We have eaten at the one in Chicago and loved the breakfasts so were thrilled to find it.  It is such a cute place and I love the French vibe. I had the waffle and it was the best waffle I have ever had!  I think it was more like a Liege waffle with little crunchy pieces of sugar in it, although they don't describe it as such. They have great bread to go along with the soft boiled eggs that my husband had.  
It was pretty small inside and you better not mind having to listen to your neighbor's conversations because the small tables are close together or you eat at a communal table but that is becoming the norm now.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: We had a leisurely breakfast here on a Tuesday morning.  It was crowded and had a nice vibe, but not too busy that you couldn't relax.  So many healthy options - I had the shrimp avocado toast, which was outstanding - and a good portion.  My wife had the oatmeal which was a big serving, and tasty, just not too sweet (as expected).  The kale smoothie was excellent, but a little small for $9 smoothie.  Overall a great visit, and we would definitely visit this regularly if we lived nearby.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are so happy to hear you had such a nice dining experience and have passed along your comments to our team. We hope to see you again.

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasant but pricey
data.text:
We visited Alexandria for the first time today, and dropped in for a light lunch. The surroundings are pleasant, and the staff were friendly and attentive. We chose the turkey and avocado open sandwich, which was tasty. 
We really liked Le Pain Quotidien, but probably won't eat there again as we thought the food, though good, was overpriced.

data.title: Excellent Breakfast
data.text: I really like this restaurant and the food is very good. The service is usually pretty good. Love their lattes and their cocoa is to die for!  Of coarse their bread (pain) is amazing as well as their desserts. I like that they have many healthy options. In the evening they have nice music playing in the background, which is a pleasant change from many of the loud restaurants.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for dining with us and so glad you had such a wonderful experience. See you next time!

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place for a quick bite without spending a fortune
data.text: This is an excellent place for good pastries and a decent cup of coffee.  The ambiance is nice, and there's room to sit down and relax (unlike the chain coffee shops).

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for dining with us! We are glad to hear you had such a nice time.

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love the fresh food - try all the jellies and spreads!
data.text:
Recently was in Alexandria for a little site seeing and touring. The temperature in DC was a stunning 90 degrees and the minute you stepped outside it felt like you were walking in soup. We stopped into Le Pain Quotidien on King street and immediately were greeted with a smile and a seat.  The smell of fresh bread and the menu items were terrific! I was transported to my youth in Germany when I tasted the warm bread and I the jams and spreads were to die for! I recommend you try them all. 

I had a wonderful tomato and avocado omelette while my friends tried the shrimp and soap platters. All the food was superb. 

Definitely try this spot if you are looking for a little taste of Europe in Alexandria.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for stopping in while touring and site seeing in Alexandria. We are so glad we were able to bring back such a wonderful memory from your youth. We hope to see you again soon!

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food, short hours
data.text: Sadly, we should have dined here for dinner but didn't however we did stop in for desserts. The menu was wide ranging & seemed fresh. Unfortunately, we had only enough time to grab them to go before they closed. I had a refreshing stone fruit tea with a chocolate chip cookie. Both were delicious.

owner_response.author: LePainQuotidien, Guest Relations Manager at Le Pain Quotidien, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Greetings,

Thanks for stopping in for dessert at LPQ. Hopefully, we will see you again and you can join us for a full dining experience!

Bianca W
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Coffee and Snacks or Lunch
data.text: Although this restaurant is part of a chain, you would never guess this from visiting this location.  The service is friendly and low key, the coffee is excellent as are the breakfast treats.

data.title: Great Cold Brew Coffee
data.text: Le Pain is a chain coffee shop with upscale European pastries and high quality, organic food and coffee. Service was very friendly and prompt. Great spot for brunch or to grab a coffee to go!

data.title: Good Breakfast in the Heart of Alexandria
data.text:
Breakfast in a town like Alexandria can be difficult, particularly if you want to go beyond typical hotel restaurant fare.

Judging by the take-out and table traffic, Le Pain Quotidien is the option frequently chosen by both locals and visitors.

Le Pain has seating on two levels – we were seated on the first level, dangerously close to a display case full of baked wonderment. The second level is presumably quieter, but is only accessible by stairs – an issue for the significant number of strollers that appeared during our visit.

A chicken chorizo cheddar omelet for me, and a Paris ham and gruyere egg white omelet with side salad for her, and we were off. Both were excellent. Service – from order-taking to plates on table – was quick and friendly, the coffee was good and plentiful. 

And the display case? It surrendered more than it should have for the trip home. All were outstanding, particularly the lemon tart. 

Good stuff, and we’ll return.

data.title: Breakfast with pizzazz!
data.text: We stayed in Alexandria over Memorial Day weekend and headed out for an early breakfast and having read the reviews fell into this place. First of all the service is terrific.  Secondly the food is spectacular.  We both ordered the mushroom and goat's cheese omelet and I ordered the fresh fruit too (incredible).  The omelet comes with two "hunks" of organic bread--baguette and sourdough rye.  Great!  Good hot coffee and while others have commented that it comes in a pot and is enough for one cup we got several cups from our pot and then had to fight off the waitress wanting to add more to our pot.  I highly recommend this spot for a lovely breakfast on a Sunday morning (or any other day of the week).

data.title: Euro-breakfast in Old Town
data.text: It is a little noisy and a little pricey but fun and tasty for weekend brunch. European style dishes, and copies of their own tasty cookbooks on the farmhouse tables, make for a different & pleasant experience. The flatbreads, frittatas, good breads, pastries, parfaits , fruits, and pots of thick fruit jams make for good eating. Complaint... Coffee is excellent and dark but comes in a pot that is too small, only a mug full. Cappuccino, on the other hand, comes in a very big cup and was delicious. The cookbook on the table provided lots of conversation subject matter, and we found we could order used copies on Amazon for a reasonable price – we did. The staff was friendly and quick in-service and you were right in the heart of old town, and easy walking distance of the Potomac river and lots of sites and shops for the day's entertainment. Generous brunch for two ran $50 including tips.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: We popped in here for a snack while in Alexandria.  The coconut macaroons were AMAZING!  The best ones I've ever had.  The croissants were so fresh and buttery.
